newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo Nikkei average closes at new 1997 high.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo Nikkei average closes at new 1997 high.

text.p: The Tokyo stock market's benchmark Nikkei average closed at a new high for 1997, ending above the 20,500 threshold for the first time since December.
Brokers said strength in stock futures and continued interest in high-technology issues, especially laggards, boosted the index.
The 225-share Nikkei average finished the session at 20,563.16, up 111.31 points or 0.54 percent. It was the highest close since 20,568.38 on December 11.
Nikkei 225 June futures closed at 20,560, up 120 points.

"Futures were especially firm and so were laggards in the high-technology sector," said Tadahiro Kamogawa, Yamaichi Securities general manager. "But there was also pressure from profit-taking, keeping a tight rein on gains."
